overview:
Jeffrey Johnston is a 25 year entrepreneur who has started five companies since leaving the employment of Duke University Medical Center in 1984. He received his MBA from The Fuqua School of Business, Duke University, in 1981.

Mr. Johnston headed the development operation for the Duke Cancer Center when it first became the “Comprehensive Cancer Center” in 1977. He later became the Administrator of The Cancer Center before leaving to set-up his first company in 1984.

Below are the companies he has founded:

  • Health Innovations, Inc. (no-fault malocurrence insurance for hospitals)
  • Johnston, Zabor, McManus (health care market research)

The following companies were founded, based on decision software created by Mr. Johnston. This software did obtain patent protection in 2004.

  • Decision Innovations, Inc. (technology company based on decision software)
  • Asparity Decision Solutions, Inc. (health plan decision tool company)
  • BestHomePro, Inc. (real estate lead generation company

degrees.subject: Business
degrees.institution: Fuqua School of Business, Duke University
